indentRainbow.indicatorStyle.markdownDescription: Classic mode uses a full colored tab to indicate the indendation. Light mode will only display a colored border similar to the default indent guide lines. You can disable the default indicators with `#editor.guides.indentation#`.

indentRainbow.lightIndicatorStyleLineWid.description: This property defines the indent indicator lineWidth when using light mode.

print.filepathAsDocumentHeading.description: Optional heading at the start of each file

print.filepathHeadingForIndividuallyPrin.description: Show the file path as a heading when a document is printed individually

print.filepathInDocumentTitle.markdownDescription: HTML page title, used by some browsers in the page header (to control the heading that can appear at the start of the document, use **Filepath as Document Heading**)
markdownEnumDescriptions: `C:\...\folder-containing\filename.ext` (you will have to edit the name when saving a PDF)
A path relative to the workspace folder

enumDescriptions: Single spaced
Line and a half
Double spaced

print.renderMarkdown.description: Render Markdown as HTML when printing

print.logLevel.markdownDescription: Log level `Error` will log only errors (very few entries) whereas `info` will log errors, warnings and info. `Debug` is good for troubleshooting. `Silly` will log absolutely everything but the log file will grow fast.

print.browserPath.description: Path to the executable of an alternate browser

print.colourScheme.markdownDescription: [Stylesheet preview is available online](https://highlightjs.org/static/demo/). Only 'light' versions are offered because paper is white.

print.printAndClose.description: Show the Print dialog when the browser is ready, and try to close the page after printing is done or cancelled

print.editorContextMenuItemPosition.markdownDescription: The position of `Print` in the editor context menu

print.editorTitleMenuButton.description: Print the content of the active editor

print.folder.fileNames.description: Include file names as section titles when printing content of a folder

print.folder.include.description: A glob pattern for inclusions when printing the content of a folder. Empty means all.

print.folder.exclude.description: A glob pattern for exclusions when printing the content of a folder. Files of types that are known to be binary are always excluded.

print.folder.maxLines.description: Upper limit for file size, in lines of text. Files larger than this are ignored.

print.folder.maxFiles.description: The maximium number of files that folder print will render. For a folder with more files, you get only the summary.

print.folder.includeFileList.description: Begin with a list of files when printing the content of a folder.

cssPeek.supportTags.description: Enable Peeking from HTML tags in addition to classnames and IDs. React components are ignored, but it's a good idea to disable this feature when using Angular

cssPeek.peekFromLanguages.description: A list of vscode language names where the extension should be used.

cssPeek.peekToExclude.description: A list of file globs that filters out peekable files

cssPeek.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the language server.

sqliteViewer.maxFileSize.description: The maximum file size the extension will attempt to load in MB. Set to 0 to disable the limit.

liveServer.settings.port.description: Set Custom Port Number of Live Server. Set 0 if you want random port.

liveServer.settings.root.description:
Set Custom root of Live Server. 
To change root the the server to sub folder of workspace, use '/' and relative path from workspace. 
Example: /subfolder1/subfolder2

liveServer.settings.CustomBrowser.description:
Specify custom browser settings for Live Server. 
By Default it will open your default favorite browser.

liveServer.settings.ChromeDebuggingAttac.description:
Enable Chrome Debugging Attachment to Live Server at Debuging Port 9222.
 NOTE: You have to install 'Debugger for Chrome' 
If the value is true, Select 'Attach to Chrome' from Debug Window to start debugging. 

 CAUTION: If it is true, 'Launch Chrome against localhost' may not work.

liveServer.settings.AdvanceCustomBrowser.description:
Note: If it is not Null, It will override CustomBrowser and ChromeDebuggingAttachment settings.

 Examples : 
chrome --incognito --headless --remote-debugging-port=9222 
 C:\\Program Files\\Firefox Developer Edition\\firefox.exe --private-window

liveServer.settings.showOnStatusbar.description: Change this to false if you don't want the button to show in the statusbar

liveServer.settings.NoBrowser.description: If it is true live server will start without browser opened.

liveServer.settings.mount.description: Mount a directory to a route. Such as [['/components', './node_modules']]

liveServer.settings.donotShowInfoMsg.description: To disable information pop up messages.

liveServer.settings.donotVerifyTags.description: To turn off prompt warning message if body or head or other supporting tag is missing in your HTML.

liveServer.settings.host.description: To switch between localhost or 127.0.0.1 or anything else. Default is 127.0.0.1

enable.description: Make it true to enable the feature.

liveServer.settings.useWebExt.description: You have to install a browser extension. That will be works for your dynamic pages (like PHP).

liveServer.settings.wait.description: Delay before live reloading. Value in milliseconds. Default is 100

liveServer.settings.fullReload.description: By Default Live Server inject CSS changes without full reloading of browser. You can change this behavior by making this setting as `true`

enable.description: Make it true to enable it.

liveServer.settings.file.description: When set, serve this file (server root relative) for every 404 (useful for single-page applications)

liveServer.settings.multiRootWorkspaceNa.description: This the entry point of server when you're in multiroot workspace

sass.disableAutoIndent.description: Stop the extension from automatically indenting when pressing Enter

sass.disableUnitCompletion.description: adds units to the intellisense completions if false.

sass.disableCommentCompletion.description: adds magic comments to the intellisense completions if false.

sass.format.setPropertySpace.description: If true space between the property: value, is always set to 1.

sass.andStared.description: items in this array will be at the top of the completion list (only for items that show after the & sign)

lldb.consoleMode.description: Controls whether the debug console input is by default treated as debugger commands or as expressions to evaluate.
enumDescriptions: Treat debug console input as debugger commands.  In order to evaluate an expression, prefix it with '?' (question mark).
Treat debug console input as expressions.  In order to execute a debugger command, prefix it with '`' (backtick).
(experimental) Use the debug console for warningevaluation of expressions, open a separate terminal for input of LLDB commands.

lldb.evaluationTimeout.description: Timeout for expression evaluation, in seconds.

lldb.displayFormat.description: Default format for displayed variable values.

lldb.dereferencePointers.description: Whether to show summaries of the pointees instead of numeric values of the pointers themselves.

enumDescriptions: Only when source is not available.
Never show.
Always show, even if source is available.

lldb.suppressMissingSourceFiles.description: Suppress VSCode's messages about missing source files (when debug info refers to files not available on the local machine).

lldb.dbgconfig.description: Common user-defined settings that can be inserted into launch configurations using ${dbgconfig:name} syntax.

lldb.launch.initCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *before* initCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.preRunCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *before* preRunCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.postRunCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *before* postRunCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.exitCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *after* exitCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.env.description: Additional environment variables merged with 'env' individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.envFile.description: File to read the environment variables from.

enumDescriptions: Use integrated terminal in VSCode.
Use external terminal window.
Use VScode Debug Console for stdout and stderr. Stdin will be unavailable.

lldb.launch.stdio.description: Default destination for stdio streams: null = send to debugger console or a terminal, "<path>" = attach to a file/tty/fifo.

lldb.launch.expressions.description: The default evaluator type used for expressions.

lldb.launch.sourceMap.description: Additional entries that will be merged with 'sourceMap's of individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.breakpointMode.description: Specifies how source breakpoints should be set.
enumDescriptions: Resolve locations using full source file path.
Resolve locations using file name only.

lldb.launch.sourceLanguages.description: A list of source languages to enable language-specific features for.

lldb.launch.relativePathBase.description: Default base directory used for resolution of relative source paths.  Defaults to "${workspaceFolder}".

lldb.rpcServer.description: Start an RPC server that will accept debug configuration requests.

lldb.library.markdownDescription:
Which LLDB library to use.

This can be either a file path (recommended) or a directory, in which case platform-specific heuristics will be used to locate the actual library file.

lldb.cargo.markdownDescription: Name of the command to invoke as Cargo.

lldb.adapterEnv.description: Extra environment variables for the debug adapter.

lldb.reproducer.markdownDescription:
Enable capture of a [reproducer](https://lldb.llvm.org/design/reproducers.html).
May also contain a path of the directory to save the reproducer in.

lldb.terminalPromptClear.description: A sequence of strings sent to the terminal in order to clear its command prompt.

lldb.evaluateForHovers.description: Enable value preview when cursor is hovering over a variable.

lldb.commandCompletions.description: Enable command completions in debug console.

intellicodeApiExamples.python.enabled.description: Enable API Usage Examples for Python files

intellicodeApiExamples.typescript.enable.description: Enable API Usage Examples for Typescript/Javascript files

vsintellicode.python.completionsEnabled.description: Enable Visual Studio IntelliCode completions for Python

vsintellicode.sql.completionsEnabled.description: Enable Visual Studio IntelliCode completions for MSSQL

vsintellicode.java.completionsEnabled.description: Enable Visual Studio IntelliCode completions for Java

vsintellicode.typescript.completionsEnab.description: Enable Visual Studio IntelliCode completions for TypeScript and JavaScript

vsintellicode.modify.editor.suggestSelec.markdownDescription: Control whether Visual Studio IntelliCode will modify `editor.suggestSelection` if it is set to a value (`recentlyUsed`) that will result in IntelliCode suggested completion items not being visible.
enumDescriptions: Allows IntelliCode to modify the editor.suggestSelection setting on your behalf.
You've explicitly opted out of having this configuration controlled by IntelliCode.
(DO NOT SET THIS MANUALLY) IntelliCode will set this to record that configuration has been automatically modified to override a default value.
(DO NOT SET THIS MANUALLY) IntelliCode will set this to record that you've chosen to let IntelliCode change the configuration from a value that was explicitly set.

vsintellicode.modelDownloadPath.description: Specifies the folder path where downloaded model files are stored. Defaults to the extension install directory if not specified.

gradle.autoDetect.description: Controls whether Gradle tasks should be automatically detected

anyOf.description: Discover specific nested projects (by directory name)

gradle.nestedProjects.description: Discover Gradle projects in nested sub-directories

enumDescriptions: Use a dedicated terminal for a specific task. The terminal is not shared with other tasks.
Create a new terminal when a task is executed.
Share the terminal with other tasks.
gradle.reuseTerminals.markdownDescription: Reuse task terminals behaviour, will be overridden to `off` if `gradle.allowParallelRun` is true.

gradle.debug.description: Show extra debug information in the output panel

gradle.disableConfirmations.description: Disable the warning confirm messages when performing batch actions

gradle.focusTaskInExplorer.description: Focus the task in the explorer when running a task

gradle.javaDebug.cleanOutput.description: Clean the task output cache before debugging

gradle.javaDebug.deprecationMessage: This setting will be removed in the future since the extension can automatically get debug tasks, for clean options, please see `gradle.javaDebug.cleanOutput`.

tasks.description: List of JavaExec tasks to debug

clean.description: Clean the task output cache before debugging

gradle.showStoppedDaemons.description: Show stopped daemons in the Gradle Daemons view

gradle.allowParallelRun.markdownDescription: Allow to run tasks in parallel, each running will create a new terminal. This configuration will override `gradle.reuseTerminals` and always create new task terminals when running or debugging a task.

gradle.projectOpenBehaviour.description: Default method of opening newly created project.

java.debug.logLevel.description: Minimum level of debugger logs that are sent to VS Code.

java.debug.settings.showHex.description: Show numbers in hex format in "Variables" viewlet.

java.debug.settings.showQualifiedNames.description: Show fully qualified class names in "Variables" viewlet.

java.debug.settings.showLogicalStructure.description: Show the logical structure for the Collection and Map classes in "Variables" viewlet.

java.debug.settings.showToString.description: Show 'toString()' value for all classes that override 'toString' method in "Variables" viewlet.

java.debug.settings.maxStringLength.description: The maximum length of strings displayed in "Variables" or "Debug Console" viewlet, strings longer than this length will be trimmed, if 0 no trim is performed.

java.debug.settings.numericPrecision.description: The precision when formatting doubles in "Variables" or "Debug Console" viewlet.

java.debug.settings.hotCodeReplace.description: Reload the changed Java classes during debugging.

java.debug.settings.enableRunDebugCodeLe.description: Enable the run and debug code lens providers over main methods.

java.debug.settings.forceBuildBeforeLaun.description: Force building the workspace before launching java program. If 'java.autobuild.enabled' is disabled, this setting will be ignored and still force a build job before launching.

java.debug.settings.onBuildFailureProcee.description: Force to proceed when build fails

enumDescriptions: VS Code debug console (input stream not supported).
VS Code integrated terminal.
External terminal that can be configured in user settings.
java.debug.settings.console.description: The specified console to launch Java program. If you want to customize the console for a specific debug session, please modify the 'console' config in launch.json.

java.debug.settings.exceptionBreakpoint..description: Specifies a set of exception types you want to break on, e.g. java.lang.NullPointerException. A specific exception type and its subclasses can be selected for caught exceptions, uncaught exceptions, or both can be selected.
Specifies the allowed locations where the exception breakpoint can break on. Wildcard is supported, e.g. java.*, *.Foo

Skip the specified classes when breaking on exception. You could use the built-in variables such as '$JDK' and '$Libraries' to skip a group of classes, or add a specific class name expression, e.g. java.*, *.Foo

enumDescriptions: Skip the JDK classes from the default system bootstrap classpath, such as rt.jar, jrt-fs.jar.
Skip the classes from application libraries, such as Maven, Gradle dependencies.
Skip the class loaders.
Skip the specified classes. Class names should be fully qualified. Wildcard is supported, e.g. java.*, *.Foo

java.debug.settings.stepping.skipClasses.description: Skip the specified classes when stepping. You could use the built-in variables such as '$JDK' and '$Libraries' to skip a group of classes, or add a specific class name expression, e.g. java.*, *.Foo

enumDescriptions: Skip the JDK classes from the default system bootstrap classpath, such as rt.jar, jrt-fs.jar.
Skip the classes from application libraries, such as Maven, Gradle dependencies.
Skip the class loaders.
Skip the specified classes. Class names should be fully qualified. Wildcard is supported, e.g. java.*, *.Foo

java.debug.settings.stepping.skipStaticI.description: Skip static initializer methods when stepping.

java.debug.settings.jdwp.limitOfVariable.description: The maximum number of variables or fields that can be requested in one JDWP request. The higher the value, the less frequently debuggee will be requested when expanding the variable view. Also a large number can cause JDWP request timeout.

java.debug.settings.jdwp.requestTimeout.description: The timeout (ms) of JDWP request when the debugger communicates with the target JVM.

java.debug.settings.jdwp.async.description: Experimental: Controls whether the debugger is allowed to send JDWP commands asynchronously. Async mode can improve remote debugging response speed on high-latency networks.

java.debug.settings.vmArgs.description: The default VM arguments to launch the Java program. Eg. Use '-Xmx1G -ea' to increase the heap size to 1GB and enable assertions. If you want to customize the VM arguments for a specific debug session, please modify the 'vmArgs' config in launch.json.

java.debug.settings.debugSupportOnDecomp.description: [Experimental]: Enable debugging support on the decompiled source code. Be aware that this feature may affect the loading speed of Call Stack Viewlet.

java.silentNotification.description: Controls whether notifications can be used to report progress. If true, use status bar to report progress instead.

java.dependency.showMembers.description: Show the members in the explorer

java.dependency.syncWithFolderExplorer.description: Synchronize Java Projects explorer selection with folder explorer

java.dependency.autoRefresh.description: Synchronize Java Projects explorer with changes

java.dependency.refreshDelay.description: The delay time (ms) the auto refresh is invoked when changes are detected

java.dependency.packagePresentation.description: Package presentation mode: flat or hierarchical

java.project.explorer.showNonJavaResourc.description: When enabled, the explorer shows non-Java resources.

maven.settingsFile.description: Specifies the absolute path of your maven configuration file, the default value is ~/.m2/settings.xml

maven.excludedFolders.description: Specifies file path pattern of folders to exclude while searching for Maven projects.

maven.executable.preferMavenWrapper.description: Specifies whether you prefer to use Maven wrapper. If true, it tries using 'mvnw' by walking up the parent folders. If false, or 'mvnw' is not found, it tries 'mvn' in PATH instead.

maven.executable.path.description: Specifies absolute path of your 'mvn' executable. When this value is empty, it tries using 'mvn' or 'mvnw' according to the value of 'maven.executable.preferMavenWrapper'.

maven.executable.options.description: Specifies default options for all mvn commands.

maven.terminal.useJavaHome.description: If this value is true, and if the setting java.home has a value, then the environment variable JAVA_HOME will be set to the value of java.home when a new terminal window is created.

environmentVariable.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

value.description: Value of the environment variable to set.

maven.terminal.customEnv.description: Specifies an array of environment variable names and values. These environment variable values will be added to the terminal session before Maven is first executed.

alias.description: A short name for the command.

debug.description: Whether to execute in debug mode.

maven.terminal.favorites.description: Specify pre-defined favorite commands to execute.

maven.view.description: Specifies the way of viewing Maven projects.

maven.showInExplorerContextMenu.description: If this value is true, add a command to create Maven Projects in the Explorer context menu for folders.

maven.pomfile.globPattern.description: Specifies the glob pattern used to look for pom.xml files.

maven.pomfile.autoUpdateEffectivePOM.description: Specifies whether to update effective-pom automatically whenever changes detected.

maven.pomfile.prefetchEffectivePom.description: Specifies whether to prefetch effective pom on startup.

maven.dependency.enableConflictDiagnosti.description: Specify whether to show diagnostics for conflict dependencies.

maven.projectOpenBehavior.description: Default method of opening newly created project.

maven.explorer.projectName.description: Format of project node name shown in Maven explorer.

markdown.extension.bold.indicator.markdownDescription: Use `**` or `__` to wrap bold text.

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Adaptive indentation size according to the context, trying to **left align the sublist with its parent's content**. For example:

```markdown
- Parent
  - Sublist

1. Parent
   1. Sublist

10. Parent with longer marker
    1. Sublist
```

Use the configured tab size of the current document (see the status bar). For example (with `tabSize: 4`):

```markdown
- Parent
    - Sublist

1. Parent
    1. Sublist

10. Parent with longer marker
    1. Sublist
```
markdown.extension.list.indentationSize.markdownDescription:
List indentation scheme. (Also affects TOC generation.)

Whether to use different indentation sizes on different list contexts or stick to VS Code's tab size.

markdown.extension.list.toggle.candidate.description: List candidate markers. It will cycle through those markers

markdown.extension.math.enabled.description: Enable basic math support (Powered by KaTeX).

terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.linux.markdownDescription: The default terminal profile on Linux.

terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.osx.markdownDescription: The default terminal profile on macOS.

terminal.integrated.defaultProfile.windo.markdownDescription: The default terminal profile on Windows.
markdownEnumDescriptions:
$(terminal) Git Bash
- path: C:\Program Files\Git\bin\bash.exe
- args: ['--login','-i']

enumDescriptions: Use VS Code's integrated terminal.
Use the configured external terminal.
Use the other two together.
terminal.explorerKind.description: When opening a file from the Explorer in a terminal, determines what kind of terminal will be launched

terminal.external.windowsExec.description: Customizes which terminal to run on Windows.

terminal.external.osxExec.description: Customizes which terminal application to run on macOS.

terminal.external.linuxExec.description: Customizes which terminal to run on Linux.

settingsSync.ignoredExtensions.markdownDescription: List of extensions to be ignored while synchronizing. The identifier of an extension is always `${publisher}.${name}`. For example: `vscode.csharp`.

settingsSync.ignoredSettings.description: Configure settings to be ignored while synchronizing.

workbench.editor.autoLockGroups.description: If an editor matching one of the listed types is opened as the first in an editor group and more than one group is open, the group is automatically locked. Locked groups will only be used for opening editors when explicitly chosen by a user gesture (for example drag and drop), but not by default. Consequently, the active editor in a locked group is less likely to be replaced accidentally with a different editor.

workbench.editor.defaultBinaryEditor.description: The default editor for files detected as binary. If undefined, the user will be presented with a picker.

workbench.editorAssociations.markdownDescription: Configure [glob patterns](https://aka.ms/vscode-glob-patterns) to editors (for example `"*.hex": "hexEditor.hexedit"`). These have precedence over the default behavior.

workbench.editorLargeFileConfirmation.markdownDescription: Controls the minimum size of a file in MB before asking for confirmation when opening in the editor. Note that this setting may not apply to all editor types and environments.

^(\\[([^\\]]+)\\])+$.description: Configure editor settings to be overridden for a language.
